page.title: 01A rural area near Thorverton
page.content: Four parishes meet in this area. It is farming land, dominated by Raddon Top, site of an ancient beacon which linked with others last seen alight on the night of Prince Charle's wedding. The north-western corner is cut by the Tiverton to Crediton road, normally quiet except in the holiday season but unexpectedly, perhaps uniquely, crowded recently when the retinue of cricketer Ian Botham passed by on his charity walk from John O'Groats to Land's End. The volcanic stone from Raddon Quarry was once much used in building local churches, and city walls & houses in Exeter; now the quarry is overgrown & threatened with exploitation as a tip for Crediton's rubbish. At Chapel Farm in the mid- 19th Century Mr Thomas Kingdon bred giant sheep - "Pluto" allegedly weighed 409 pounds - and produced
